scenarios.name: Successful Login and Creation of a Task with Individual User Assignment
scenarios.description: Verifies a user can log in for the first time in a session, select a company, navigate to the Tasks page, and create a new task with a name, due date, and assign it to specific, existing team members by email.
user_journey: Navigate to Application base URL and wait for the login page to load.
Enter the email from Excel into the email input field.
Click the Continue button.
Enter the password from Excel into the password input field.
Click the Login button.
Wait for the company selection page and click the company name from Excel.
Click on 'Action Items' menu item in the navigation.
Click on 'Tasks' submenu option and wait for the Manage Tasks page to load.
Click the 'New Task' button to open the task creation form.
Enter the task name from Excel into the 'Short Task Name' input field.
Click the date picker input field and enter the due date from Excel in MM/DD/YYYY format, then press ENTER.
For each email address in the 'Assigned_To' field from Excel:
Click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field.
Enter the user email address.
Wait 2 seconds for the autocomplete dropdown.
Click the matching user option from the dropdown to select them.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the Save button.
Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully authenticates and navigates to the Manage Tasks page.
The 'New Task' form opens and all required fields are populated correctly.
Each specified user email is found in the autocomplete dropdown and successfully selected.
The task is created successfully and the system returns to the Manage Tasks page.
The 'New Task' button is visible, confirming the user is on the correct page and ready for the next action.
test_data_requirements: A valid Email and Password for an existing user.
A valid Company_Name associated with the user.
A unique Task_Name.
A valid Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
A comma-separated list of emails in 'Assigned_To' for users who already exist in the system.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Users' Bulk Assignment
scenarios.description: Verifies that a task can be created and assigned to all users in the system using the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox option.
user_journey: Assuming the user is already logged in and on the Manage Tasks page, click the 'New Task' button.
Enter the task name from Excel into the 'Short Task Name' input field.
Enter the due date from Excel in MM/DD/YYYY format into the date picker.
Scroll down and locate the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox.
Click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
Wait for the selection to register.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the Save button.
Wait for the Manage Tasks page to reload.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully selected.
The task is created successfully upon clicking the Save button.
The system returns to the Manage Tasks page after task creation.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name.
A valid Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
The 'Assigned_To' field in Excel must contain the exact text 'Assign to all Users'.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'File' Document Upload
scenarios.description: Verifies that a task can be created with an attached document of type 'File'.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the 'New Task' form, fill in the Task Name and Due Date.
Complete the 'Assigned_To' section as per test data.
Scroll down to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
Wait for the document upload dialog to open.
Enter the Document_Name from Excel in the 'Enter document name' field.
Enter the Document_Description from Excel in the description field.
Locate the hidden file input element and make it visible using JavaScript.
Construct the full file path using the base path and the Document_File from Excel.
Send the full file path to the now-visible file input element.
Wait 2 seconds for the file upload to complete.
Click the Save button in the document dialog.
Wait 3 seconds for the dialog to close and the document to appear as attached.
Click the main Save button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The document upload dialog opens successfully.
Document name and description are entered correctly.
The specified file is successfully uploaded from the local path.
The document dialog closes and the document is shown as attached to the task form.
The task with the file attachment is created successfully.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and valid Due_Date.
Valid assignment data in 'Assigned_To'.
A valid Document_Name.
An optional Document_Description.
Document_Type must be 'File'.
A valid Document_File (e.g., 'report.pdf') that exists at the specified 'File_Upload_Base_Path'.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with a 'Link' Document Attachment
scenarios.description: Verifies that a task can be created with an attached document of type 'Link'.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the 'New Task' form, fill in the Task Name and Due Date.
Complete the 'Assigned_To' section as per test data.
Scroll down to the Documents section and click the '+' icon.
Wait for the document upload dialog to open.
Enter the Document_Name from Excel in the 'Enter document name' field.
Enter the Document_Description from Excel in the description field.
Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
Enter the Document_URL from Excel in the 'Enter Link...' field.
Click the Save button in the document dialog.
Wait 3 seconds for the dialog to close and the document to appear as attached.
Click the main Save button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The document upload dialog opens successfully.
Document name and description are entered correctly.
The document type is successfully changed to 'Link'.
The specified URL is entered correctly.
The document dialog closes and the link is shown as attached to the task form.
The task with the link attachment is created successfully.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and valid Due_Date.
Valid assignment data in 'Assigned_To'.
A valid Document_Name.
An optional Document_Description.
Document_Type must be 'Link'.
A valid Document_URL (e.g., 'https://example.com/doc').

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation with Alignment to Existing Priority and Huddle
scenarios.description: Verifies that a task can be successfully aligned with a pre-existing Priority and a pre-existing Huddle during creation.
user_journey: Assuming the user is on the 'New Task' form, fill in the Task Name, Due Date, and assignment.
Scroll to the Priority alignment field and click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input.
Enter the priority name from the 'Align_Priority' field in Excel.
Wait 2.5 seconds for the dropdown to populate.
Click the matching priority option from the dropdown to select it.
Scroll to the Huddle alignment field and click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input.
Enter the huddle name from the 'Align_Huddle' field in Excel.
Wait 2.5 seconds for the dropdown to populate.
Click the matching huddle option from the dropdown to select it.
Click the main Save button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The specified Priority is found in the autocomplete dropdown and is successfully selected.
The specified Huddle is found in the autocomplete dropdown and is successfully selected.
The task is created successfully with the correct Priority and Huddle alignments.
test_data_requirements: A unique Task_Name and valid Due_Date.
Valid assignment data in 'Assigned_To'.
An 'Align_Priority' value that corresponds to a pre-existing Priority in the system.
An 'Align_Huddle' value that corresponds to a pre-existing Huddle in the system.

scenarios.name: Successful Processing of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
scenarios.description: Verifies the system can process multiple task creation requests from an Excel file sequentially within the same user session without requiring re-login.
user_journey: Execute PHASE 1 (User Authentication) for the first row in the Excel file.
Execute PHASE 2 (Create Task) for the first row.
Verify the system is on the Manage Tasks page by checking for the 'New Task' button.
For the second row in the Excel file, skip PHASE 1.
Execute PHASE 2 (Create Task) for the second row.
Repeat the process for all subsequent rows in the Excel file.
After the last task is created, close the browser.
acceptance_criteria: The user logs in only once at the beginning of the test.
The user session remains active throughout the entire execution.
Each task from the Excel file is created successfully in sequence.
The system correctly remains on or returns to the Manage Tasks page after each task creation, ready for the next one.
test_data_requirements: An Excel file with at least two rows of complete and valid task data.
The first row must contain valid login credentials (Email, Password, Company_Name).
Subsequent rows do not need login credentials but require all necessary task data.

dependencies: The test environment must have stable network connectivity.
The Excel test data file must contain valid and accurate data for all required fields.
User credentials provided in the Excel file must be valid and active.
The Company Name provided must exist and be associated with the user account.
For individual assignments, the specified user emails must correspond to existing users in the system.
For Priority and Huddle alignments, the specified names must match pre-existing Priorities and Huddles.
For file uploads, the specified file must exist at the configured 'File_Upload_Base_Path'.
edge_cases: Creating a single task that successfully utilizes every optional field: individual assignment, Priority alignment, Huddle alignment, and a document attachment (File or Link).
Processing a large Excel file (e.g., 20+ tasks) in a single session to test session persistence over a longer duration.
Successfully assigning a task to a long list of individual users (e.g., 10+ emails) in the 'Assigned_To' field.
